required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Two-day Education Program for Metabolic Syndrome Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Temporal Changes of Metabolic Indicators and Quality of Life by a Two-day Patient Education Program for Metabolic Syndrome Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study was to evaluate the temporal change of metabolic indicators and quality of life by a two-day patient education program.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aimed to evaluate whether a two-day multidisciplinary education camp comprising doctors, nurses, exercise instructors, dietitians, social workers, and health administrators could initiate healthy lifestyle habits, improve health markers though lifestyle modification, increase knowledge and understanding of the disease, and have a profitable effect on mental health in relation to depression and quality of life for patients with metabolic syndrome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in waist circumference at 3-month and 6-month after camp

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in blood pressure at 3-month and 6-month after camp

primary_outcome.measure: Korean version of EuroQol-5D (the minimum-maximum value, 0-1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in score of Korean version of EuroQol-5D at 3-month and 6-month after camp. Higher scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Korean version of Beck depression inventory-II (the minimum-maximum value, 0-63)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in score of Korean version of Beck depression inventory-II at 3-month and 6-month after camp. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Korean version of Beck anxiety inventory (the minimum-maximum value, 0-63)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in score of Korean version of Beck anxiety inventory at 3-month and 6-month after camp. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in nutritional knowledge score at 3-month and 6-month after camp. Higher scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in total cholesterol (mg/dL) level at 3-month and 6-month after camp

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in triglyceride (mg/dL) level at 3-month and 6-month after camp

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in HDL cholesterol (mg/dL) level at 3-month and 6-month after camp

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-camp at 3-month and 6-month after camp
primary_outcome.description: Change in LDL cholesterol (mg/dL) level at 3-month and 6-month after camp

arm_group.description: During the camp, the multidisciplinary team provided disease information, lifestyle modification, nutrition, and exercise for metabolic syndrome. Participants visited at 3- and 6-month after camp for follow-up.

intervention.description: During the camp, the multidisciplinary team provided disease information, lifestyle modification, nutrition, and exercise.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- people satisfied with metabolic syndrome criteria
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
